ca.nengo.ui.script

Class CallChainCompletor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.nengo.ui.script.CommandCompletor
      • ca.nengo.ui.script.CallChainCompletor

  • public class CallChainCompletor
extends CommandCompletor
    A CommandCompletor that suggests completions based on Python variable names and methods/fields of Python objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CallChainCompletor(org.python.util.PythonInterpreter interpreter)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CallChainCompletor

        public CallChainCompletor(org.python.util.PythonInterpreter interpreter)
        Parameters:
        interpreter - The Python interpreter from which variables are gleaned

    • Method Detail

      • setBase

        public void setBase(java.lang.String callChain)
        Rebuilds the completion options list from a "base" call chain.
        Parameters:
        callChain - A partial call chain, eg "x.getY().get", from which we would extract the base call chain "x.getY()". (In this case the new options list might include "x.getY().toString()", "x.getY().wait()", etc.)

      • getDocumentation

        public java.lang.String getDocumentation()
        Returns:
        Documentation for the current completion item if available, otherwise null

      • getConstructors

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getConstructors(org.python.core.PyObject pc)

      • getVariables

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getVariables()
        Returns:
        List of variable names known to the interpreter.

      • getMembers

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMembers(java.lang.String base)
        Parameters:
        base - A variable name in the interpreter. For variables that wrap Java objects, this arg can consist of a call chain, eg x.getY().getZ() For native python variables, the return type of a call isn't known, so this method can't return anything given a call chain.
        Returns:
        A list of completion options including methods (with args) and fields on the named variable.
